wikipedia_page.main: Lilian Lyle (16 March 1867 – 6 May 1953) was a British teacher, botanist, and phycologist who collected and published on a number of algae species during the 1920s. Lyle was elected a Fellow of the Linnean Society of London on 17 June 1915.

response: *Lilian Lyle (1867-1953), botanist and phycologist, studied the marine life of Guernsey during the 1920s
